byline.original: By MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

abstract: New York State Joint Commission on Public Ethics contacts political group Campaign for One New York, which was created to raise money and awareness for political agenda of New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, to ask why it has not yet registered as lobbyist.
lead_paragraph: The group, the Campaign for One New York, was created by the mayor’s political consultants to raise money and attention while operating outside the city’s limits on campaign contributions.

headline.main: Group Supporting de Blasio’s Agenda Is Said to Draw Interest of Ethics Panel
headline.print_headline: Group Supporting de Blasio’s Agenda Is Said to Draw Interest of Ethics Panel

snippet: The group, the Campaign for One New York, was created by the mayor’s political consultants to raise money and attention while operating outside the city’s limits on campaign contributions.
